intro: Azaleastrum warrenii, commonly known as the Warren's azaleastrum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and other shrubs. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
